title: Budget Bites: Rodeo Goat's Ozzmosis
description: 👋 Jay here! I wanted to share my experience trying the Ozzmosis burger at Rodeo Goat last week.
content:
👋 Jay here! I wanted to share my experience trying the Ozzmosis burger at Rodeo Goat last week.

Dig in: The masterpiece, if I may say so, is going head-to-head with another specialty burger during the restaurant's Battle of the Burgers showdown.

What to order: The Ozzmosis ($15) is made with a beef  and breakfast sausage patty, fried hash brown cake, bacon, a fried egg, American cheese, hollandaise, chives and raspberry jam.

My experience: From the first bite, I was floating. The crunch of the hash brown fry led to an explosion of the best hangover breakfast foods (it is named after Ozzy Osbourne, after all) on a bun.

If you go: 2105 Dallas St.
summary: The Ozzmosis burger, named after Ozzy Osbourne, is part of the Rodeo Goat's Battle of the Enlightenment. The burger is set to compete with another specialty burger during the restaurant's showdown. It includes a beef and breakfast sausage patty, fried hash brown cake, bacon, a fried egg, hollandaise, chives and raspberry jam.
shortSummary: Rodeo Goat's Ozzmosis burger offers an intriguing blend of beef, bacon, and a smoggy, yet ultimately forgettable;
